summary: Inspect a single source’s metadata, storage paths, cache sizes, and variant information.

usage.description: Detailed JSON payload including descriptor, storage paths, last update timestamps, archive counts, and checksum.
Readable table summarising the same data.

agent_insights: Use before destructive operations to capture the filesystem location (`rootDir`) and descriptor for backups.
Check `content.llmsFull` vs `content.llmsTxt` to confirm which variant is active.
Consult `archives` to understand how many historical snapshots are stored (useful for diff workflows).
follow_up: Combine with `blz stats --json` for a workspace-level view.
If a source is stale, jump straight to `blz refresh <alias>` (deprecated alias: `blz update <alias>`).
To remove it afterwards, call `blz remove <alias> --yes`.
